intro: Oenanthe filipenduloides f. stenoloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved water dropwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils near water bodies. Its leaves are narrow and elongated, while its small white flowers bloom in clusters. It is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, contributing to the ecological diversity of these habitats.
